laundromat.description:
Okay, so you're in a laundromat, cool, but is it typical? You better believe it is. You start to take note of what's in the room.



 There is [if d_1 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] door leading north. You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is unblocked. You don't like doors? Why not try going west, that entranceway is unguarded.

bedroom.description:
You are in a bedroom. An ordinary one.

 You make out a dresser. You check the price tag glued to the dresser. 80 bucks? What a deal! You'll have to ask where they got this![if c_0 is open and there is something in the c_0] The dresser contains [a list of things in the c_0].[end if][if c_0 is open and the c_0 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if]

You need an unblocked exit? You should try going east. There is an exit to the west. Don't worry, it is unguarded.

studio.description:
You've just shown up in a studio. You decide to start listing off everything you see in the room, as if you were in a text adventure.



You need an unguarded exit? You should try going east. There is an unblocked exit to the south.

launderette.description:
Well, here we are in the launderette. The room seems oddly familiar, as though it were only superficially different from the other rooms in the building.



There is an unguarded exit to the east. You don't like doors? Why not try going west, that entranceway is unblocked.

cookhouse.description:
You are in a cookhouse.



You need an unguarded exit? You should try going east. There is an exit to the north. Don't worry, it is unblocked.

chamber.description:
You find yourself in a chamber. A normal kind of place. You begin to take stock of what's in the room.

 You scan the room for a locker, and you find a locker![if c_1 is open and there is something in the c_1] The locker contains [a list of things in the c_1]. Now that's what I call TextWorld![end if][if c_1 is open and the c_1 contains nothing] The locker is empty, what a horrible day![end if] Hey, want to see a bed stand? Look over there, a bed stand. [if there is something on the s_0]On the bed stand you make out [a list of things on the s_0].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_0]But the thing is empty, unfortunately. You move on, clearly angry about TextWorld.[end if]

You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is unguarded. There is an exit to the west. Don't worry, it is unguarded.

office.description:
Look at you, bigshot, walking into an office like it isn't some huge deal.



 There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gate leading south. There is an exit to the east. Don't worry, it is unblocked. You need an unblocked exit? You should try going west.

kitchenette.description:
Well I'll be, you are in a place we're calling a kitchenette. You can barely contain your excitement.

 You smell an interesting smell, and follow it to a chair! The chair is usual.[if there is something on the s_1] On the chair you can see [a list of things on the s_1]. Huh, weird.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_1] But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of garbage. You think about smashing the chair to bits, throwing the bits into a pit, etc, until you get bored.[end if] You see a gleam over in a corner, where you can see a bowl. The bowl is ordinary.[if there is something on the s_2] On the bowl you make out [a list of things on the s_2].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_2] However, the bowl, like an empty bowl, has nothing on it.[end if] You bend down to tie your shoe. When you stand up, you notice a plate. The plate is typical.[if there is something on the s_3] On the plate you make out [a list of things on the s_3].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_3] Unfortunately, there isn't a thing on it.[end if]

You don't like doors? Why not try going east, that entranceway is unblocked.

pantry.description:
Well, here we are in the pantry.

 You make out a trunk.[if c_2 is open and there is something in the c_2] The trunk contains [a list of things in the c_2].[end if][if c_2 is open and the c_2 contains nothing] The trunk is empty! This is the worst thing that could possibly happen, ever![end if] You can make out a counter. The counter is typical.[if there is something on the s_4] On the counter you can see [a list of things on the s_4].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_4] But the thing hasn't got anything on it. What's the point of an empty counter?[end if]

There is an exit to the west. Don't worry, it is unblocked.

shower.description:
You find yourself in a normal kind of place. That is to say, you're in a shower. You begin to take stock of what's in the room.

 You can make out [if c_3 is locked]a locked[else if c_3 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] drawer.[if c_3 is open and there is something in the c_3] The drawer contains [a list of things in the c_3].[end if][if c_3 is open and the c_3 contains nothing] The drawer is empty! What a waste of a day![end if] You can make out a table. The table is ordinary.[if there is something on the s_5] On the table you can see [a list of things on the s_5]. Now that's what I call TextWorld![end if][if there is nothing on the s_5] The table appears to be empty. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it?[end if]

 There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gate leading north. There is [if d_1 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] door leading south.
